usefulItems: pizza pans (14 in.), pastry brush, cling wrap, kitchen towels, large bowl, parchment paper, oven
title: Blueberry and Lemon Mascarpone Dessert Pizza

ingredients.content: 1 oz olive oil, plus extra to grease
1 lemon, thin peel only, no pith
1 oz salted butter, room temperature, divided

preparations.content: Lightly grease a large bowl and set aside. Line 2 pizza pans with parchment.
Place bread flour, whole wheat flour, water, sugar, yeast, 1 oz olive oil and salt into mixing bowl and knead <b>2 min/<b>.
Form dough into a ball and transfer into prepared bowl. Cover with cling wrap and let dough rise until doubled in size (approx. 1 hr.).
Preheat oven to 450°F. Divide dough in half and place onto prepared pans. Stretch dough out to pan edges, with lightly floured fingers. Cover with clean kitchen towels and let rise 5 minutes.
Place sugar and lemon peel into mixing bowl and zest <b>15 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add mascarpone and lemon juice and mix <b>15 sec/speed 4<b>. Set aside.

Brush each pizza base with 0.5 oz butter and sprinkle each with 1 tbsp turbinado sugar. Bake for 5 minutes (450°F). Divide reserved lemon mascarpone and carefully spread onto each half-baked pizza. Sprinkle each with 6 oz blueberries and bake a further 5-7 minutes, until the blueberries burst open. Serve warm.

hintsAndTricks: A rolling pin can be used to help shape dough. Cover with a clean kitchen towel and let rise 5 minutes after rolling.
